verses.verse: O that <WH5414> you were as my brother <WH251>, that sucked <WH3243> the breasts <WH7699> of my mother <WH517>! when I should find <WH4672> you outside <WH2351>, I would kiss <WH5401> you <WH936>; Yes, I should not be despised.

I would lead <WH5090> you <WH935>, and bring you into my mother <WH517>'s house <WH1004>, who would instruct <WH3925> me <WH8248>: I would cause you to drink of spiced <WH7544> wine <WH3196> of the juice <WH6071> of my pomegranate <WH7416>.
His left hand <WH8040> should be under my head <WH7218>, and his right hand <WH3225> should embrace me <WH2263>.
I charge <WH7650> you <WH1323>, O daughters of Jerusalem <WH3389>, that you stir not up <WH5782>, nor awake <WH5782> my love <WH160>, until he please <WH2654>.

Who is this that comes up <WH5927> from the wilderness <WH4057>, leaning <WH7514> upon her beloved <WH1730>? I raised <WH5782> you up under the apple tree <WH8598>: there your mother <WH517> brought you forth <WH2254>: there she brought you forth <WH2254> that bore you <WH3205>.

Set <WH7760> me as a seal <WH2368> upon your heart <WH3820>, as a seal <WH2368> upon your arm <WH2220>: for love <WH160> is strong <WH5794> as death <WH4194>; jealousy <WH7068> is cruel <WH7186> as the grave <WH7585>: the coals <WH7565> there are coals <WH7565> of fire <WH784>, which has a most vehement flame <WH7957>.

Many <WH7227> waters <WH4325> cannot <WH3201> quench <WH3518> love <WH160>, neither can the floods <WH5104> drown <WH7857> it <WH376>: if a man would give <WH5414> all the substance <WH1952> of his house <WH1004> for love <WH160>, it would utterly <WH936> be despised <WH936>.
We have a little <WH6996> sister <WH269>, and she has no breasts <WH7699>: what shall we do <WH6213> for our sister <WH269> in the day <WH3117> when she shall be spoken for <WH1696>?
If she be a wall <WH2346>, we will build <WH1129> upon her a palace <WH2918> of silver <WH3701>: and if she be a door <WH1817>, we will enclose <WH6696> her with boards <WH3871> of cedar <WH730>.
I am a wall <WH2346>, and my breasts <WH7699> like towers <WH4026>: then was I in his eyes <WH5869> as one that found <WH4672> favor <WH7965>.

Solomon <WH8010> had a vineyard <WH3754> at Baal <WH1174>â€“hamon; he let out <WH5414> the vineyard <WH3754> unto keepers <WH5201>; every one <WH376> for the fruit <WH6529> there was to bring <WH935> a thousand <WH505> pieces of silver <WH3701>.
My vineyard <WH3754>, which is mine <WH6440>, is before me <WH8010>: you, O Solomon, must have a thousand <WH505>, and those that keep <WH5201> the fruit <WH6529> there two hundred <WH3967>.
You that live <WH3427> in the gardens <WH1588>, the companions <WH2270> listen <WH7181> to your voice <WH6963>: cause me to hear it <WH8085>.
Make haste <WH1272>, my beloved <WH1730>, and be you like <WH1819> to a roe <WH6643> or to a young <WH6082> hart <WH354> upon the mountains <WH2022> of spices <WH1314>.
